sentences.english: This is choral music of the first water.
Have you ever heard such singing, my love?
sentences.chinese: 你以前聽過這樣的唱曲麼，吾愛？

sentences.english: Or watching ants fight, listen to Chanerchangqu children.
sentences.chinese: 或者看螞蟻打架，聽蟬兒唱曲兒。

sentences.english: The chorus is a mix of Yoruba and English.
sentences.chinese: 這首合唱曲目是英語和非洲語唱的。

sentences.english: I enjoy myself when I play opera at home in a rainy dusk.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在微雨的黃昏，一個人在家唱曲。
向她道聲晚安唱曲搖籃歌。

sentences.english: Reduction of the choral score of Symphony No. 2, for voices and piano.
sentences.chinese: 爲人聲和鋼琴而作的第2交響曲中的合唱曲縮編譜。

sentences.english: Oh! The one who was singing the song is just industrious Peter.
sentences.chinese: 噢，原來唱曲的那個人就是勤勞的皮特。

sentences.english: Frankly, I don't think that we'll put a cover song on this album.
sentences.chinese: 坦率的講我們不會在這張專輯中收錄翻唱曲。

definition: to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to attend an opera/to see an opera
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
